column5: As quirky as the show was,he made me laugh. Im sure others as well.
Sure hope they are making him a casket with "genuine Saskatchewan sealskin bindings"
We used to watch it all the time! RIP "Super Dave"!

One of my faves. His latest gig was on Larry David. That dry delivery always made me howl. His brother was a great entertainer too. Can't remember his name. He had an episode on the Twilight Zone movie. Will Google later.
I remember watching the Super Dave show as a kid. Used to love it. Sad to see him go.

His actual name is Bob Einstein. Can't find his brothers name. He played the dead pan dentist on The Larry David Show. We first met Super Dave on a Canadian comedy show in the 80's playing the ill fated stunt man, I don't care what Wikipedia says that's where I first saw him. Reminded me of the Coyote on the Roadrunner cartoon.
Funny guy, he will be missed!
I remember him when he used to be on John Byner'sÂ Bizarre show before he had his own show.

thats what it was...bizarre...for some reason I was thinking I knew his stuff from SCTV. Couldn't go through an episode without him calling someone a Putz or something being strapped to him with those dang "bindings"....like Saskatchewan has seals
Think he did a few Letterman's as well in the beginning.
